title: Most Ants In A Colony Are Slackers, Study Finds
text:
Subscribe Most Ants In A Colony Are Slackers, Study Finds New research shows that many ants in a colony seem to specialize in doing nothing at all, Science Mag reports. October 9, 2015 
New research shows that many ants in a colony seem to specialize in doing nothing at all, Science Mag reports . To get a closer look at how these ants filled their time, researchers marked every member of five lab-based colonies with dots of colored paint. Over the course of 2 weeks, a high-definition camera recorded 5-minute segments of the ants in action six times a day, capturing their behavior (or lack thereof). Out of the “workers,” 71.9% were inactive at least half the time, and 25.1% were never seen working. A small fraction of the ants, just 2.6%, were always active during observation, the researchers wrote last month in Behavioral Ecology and Sociobiology .
